programs.description: A hands-on introduction to sewing for complete beginners. In just one day, you'll learn how to measure, cut, and stitch fabric — and leave with your very own handmade bag.

courses.title: Make Your Own Bag
courses.description: Learn to operate a sewing machine and complete your first project — a fully functional canvas tote bag. Designed for absolute beginners.

units.title: Machine Control & Pattern Drafting
topics: Control sewing machine (speed, stitch length, pedal use)
Draft pattern of the tote bag
Select and cut correct fabric on grain
Sew straight and curved lines on practice material

units.title: Bag Construction & Finishing
topics: Sew a patch pocket on bag body
Insert a zipper into bag opening
Finish raw fabric edges (zigzag or bias tape)
Final assembly and completion of bag

programs.tagline: Develop the fundamentals of sewing before taking your next big step
programs.description: This program at FitRight helps you develop the fundamentals of sewing before taking your next big step. In this intensive one-day workshop, you'll learn essential sewing machine skills, pattern reading, and fabric handling techniques. Perfect for beginners who want to build a solid foundation in sewing.

capabilities.outcome: Operate a sewing machine confidently and safely

competencies.statement: Thread and operate a sewing machine
Fill and insert the bobbin correctly
Control machine speed and stitch settings

capabilities.outcome: Understand and work with commercial patterns

competencies.statement: Understand grain line and fabric direction
Lay and cut fabric according to pattern instructions
Sew a pocket skirt or a tank top
Apply different stitches and seam finishes
Understand and apply shaped facing techniques

requirements.name: Materials You Will Need
requirements.notes: Note: 8-inch zipper is also required but may need to be purchased separately. Please confirm availability with the school.
